description.narrative: The Asia Foundation Timor-Leste Partnership provides build broad based support amongst diverse stakeholders within East Timor for good public policy. This component is intended to link external actors and interest groups to policy processes and support coalitions for change. It is intended to encourage constructive engagement between the GoET and other social actors and keep the momentum behind reforms. The specific activities funded under this spending proposal are: an informal forum to discuss reform issues facing East Timor, the work of AusAID and TAF, and opportunities to link the programs; the Ministry of Finance Annual Client Feedback Survey 2011; support to build coalitions of support for Public Financial Management Reform; and support to the Global Organisation of Parliamentarians Against Corruption (GOPAC Timor-Leste). The total value of this initiative is $1.2 million over 2 years, starting 2011-12.
